**Edit notes (focus: spx, 0–3 wk horizon)**  
1. Add a citation to the opening sentence (“The S&P 500 is poised…”) – use ID 97MD1FHW8 or U21K4ALYQ.  
2. Cite the structural‑terms paragraph (“Fed’s policy rate is approaching a neutral stance…”) – add 97MD1FHW8 or U21K4ALYQ.  
3. Attach a citation to the base‑case summary (“The S&P 500 trades at 6,457…”) – 97MD1FHW8.  
4. Ensure every numeric claim (e.g., 6,440 support, 6,480 resistance, 10‑year yield 4.23 %) is linked to a source ID.  
5. Keep all references to spx, ust10y, and core‑PCE within the same causal chain; remove any stray mentions of unrelated assets (e.g., oil, gold) unless they directly affect spx.  
6. Verify that all driver statements (Fed dovishness, tariff persistence, tech earnings) include inline citations (1DEM6P1Y2, 3YAQ8JUPL, U21K4ALYQ).  
7. Tighten wording to avoid vague phrases; replace “likely trigger a 1–2 % pullback” with “a 1–2 % decline if spx falls below 6,440.”  
8. Confirm that the final risk list and watch list are tied to the same 0–3 wk horizon and include the relevant IDs.
